p: After 4 and 8 h from the time of applying the ethanolic suspension of the toluene extract from the herb A. abrotanum, the recorded repellency rates were, respectively, 69.1% and 56.8% against Ixodes ricinus, and 100% and 86.7% against Aedes aegypti. For the control sample with DEET ( N, N-dietylo-m-toluamid), the repellency rates after 4 and 8 h were, respectively, 83.4% and 94.4% against Ixodes ricinus, and 100% and 95.8% against Aedes aegypti. The components that showed the highest percentage of repellency against Ixodes ricinus were camphor, coumarin and thujyl alcohol, and against Aedes aegypti coumarin, chlorogenic acid and caffeic acid [ 50].
